cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi W of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the central Gulf, aiming for the northern Gulf Coast, then slowing and bending west-northwest across southern Louisiana into east Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of Louisiana (near the mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch Sabine Pass TX eastward to the Alabama/Florida border; hurricane watch Intracoastal City LA to the MS/AL border.
weather_observation.warning_coast: None posted west of the Mississippi River delta (no warnings in Texas).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas–Louisiana border eastward to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Tuesday as the weakening center moves into east Texas.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation around 1–2 ft possible on Galveston Bay with persistent on-shore flow, but values >3 ft are not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands may drop 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inch totals Tuesday–Wednesday, producing localized flooding in low-lying areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rainbands, elevated seas and swell affecting vessel movements and bunkering operations.
